name: from late september to middle november, jacarandas bloom all over pretoria and turn the face of the city purple. it is estimated that there are almost 70 000 jacarandas growing around the many streets, parks and gardens of pretoria. jacaranda trees are not indigenous to south africa and was introduced from brazil to south africa in 1829. it is seen as an invader tree but existing jacarandas do not have to be eradicated.
